bibl.title: Studies on the Aristocracy of Late Antique Oxyrhynchus.
bibl.note: I. A vir clarissimus and a donkey driver. Edition of P. E.E.S. Misc. Inv. II 9c. 11 January 417. - II. A femina clarissima and her sailors. Re-edition of P. Mich. Inv. 3716 (= S.B. XVIII, 13928). - III. Oxyrhynchite nobles pay in gold and barley. Re-edition of P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 17024 (= S.B. XXII, 15257) and P. Mich. XV, 737, including a prosopography of the persons figuring in the two lists. - IV Eudaemon, comes, and his oikos [P. Oxy. XVI, 1949; LXII, 4349; P. Mich. Inv. 3764 (= S.B. XVIII, 13921); P. Oxy. XVI, 2016; P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 17024 (= S.B. XXII 15257)].
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. E.E.S. Misc. Inv. II 9c 145.4 P. Mich. Inv. 3716; 3764; XV, 737 P. Oxy. XVI, 1949; 2016; LXII, 4349 P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 17024
GONIS Nikolaos, Studies on the Aristocracy of Late Antique Oxyrhynchus.

I. A vir clarissimus and a donkey driver. Edition of P. E.E.S. Misc. Inv. II 9c. 11 January 417. - II. A femina clarissima and her sailors. Re-edition of P. Mich. Inv. 3716 (= S.B. XVIII, 13928). - III. Oxyrhynchite nobles pay in gold and barley. Re-edition of P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 17024 (= S.B. XXII, 15257) and P. Mich. XV, 737, including a prosopography of the persons figuring in the two lists. - IV Eudaemon, comes, and his oikos [P. Oxy. XVI, 1949; LXII, 4349; P. Mich. Inv. 3764 (= S.B. XVIII, 13921); P. Oxy. XVI, 2016; P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 17024 (= S.B. XXII 15257)].
